function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Failure to consider interactions between distinct pathogens in a common host","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of climate change projections in describing the risk of multiple vector-borne diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Heavy focus on pharmacological interventions and limited attention to environmental management at the community level","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of clean water and sanitation leading to the presence of intestinal parasitic diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Neglect of co-infection in disease control and epidemiological modeling","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underfunded health systems and ineffective health governance structures","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Atypical climatic variations leading to rift valley fever and malaria epidemics in east africa","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Weak community-level outreach systems for public health","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of surveillance and monitoring of disease status at the community level","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of reporting on coinfection and co-morbidity in existing disease distribution systems","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitations of detail in existing hdss data due to lack of extensive laboratory assessment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Performance scrutiny and contextual factors influencing community health workers","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Widespread use of community volunteers without financial support","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Normalization of existing disease patterns and organizational methods","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate community participation and empowerment","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited examples of institutionalizing participatory approaches in developing countries with limited resources and weak institutional support.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequalities at the local level and gatekeepers silencing community groups from participating and having a voice.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Long-term collaboration and stakeholder engagement required for successful disease mitigation initiatives.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Primary health care networks as an organizational base","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate monitoring of drug resistance","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Intensive educational program emphasizing prevention and curative medicine","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Local ecological factors driving site-specific interventions may not be scalable and applicable in different regions, leading to ineffective disease control measures.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of community awareness about the relationships between vector-borne diseases vbds and social, environmental, and climatic determinants may hinder the effectiveness of community-based interventions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The lack of national ownership and government-driven initiatives may hinder the effective scale-up of disease control efforts, leading to limited impact at a national level.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differential impact on different social groups due to vbds transmission","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to government outreach programs and socio-economic development opportunities for women","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Vulnerable children under 5 and pregnant women at heightened risk of vbds","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Barriers to vbd prevention, treatment, and control in tribal communities due to geographic, cultural, and social factors","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of knowledge and awareness among mobile and migrant populations about antimalarial drugs and treatment compliance","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limited research on the effectiveness of community participation in malaria control programs","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Marginalization of community participation in global malaria efforts","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of artemisinin-resistant malaria among mobile and migrant populations in cambodia","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Stigmatization of vulnerable social groups in malaria interventions","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Local perceptions and cultural norms may influence the acceptability and adaptability of program tools for disease control.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Over-reliance on one or two disease control tools may lead to ineffective and unsustainable disease control efforts.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underdeveloped integrated vector management ivm due to funding challenges, inter-sectoral cooperation, effective policy frameworks, and disciplinary divides.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of large-scale trials for integrated vector control approach for diseases like malaria, leishmaniasis, lymphatic filariasis, and dengue.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Narrow focus in disease elimination programs neglecting common vectors transmitting multiple diseases in the same communities , global programme to eliminate lymphatic filariasis .","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of aedes aegypti breeding sites in water containers in dengue-endemic areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential transmission of schistosomiasis in china","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High prevalence of guppies around households","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges of maintaining guppy distribution system","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High malaria transmission related to vulnerable populations","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of integration between disease elimination and broader health and development issues.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Synergies between elimination efforts for various diseases may not be fully exploited.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulties in prioritization as elimination-targeted diseases become less common at community and country levels.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of synergy between top-down and bottom-up approaches","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Bottlenecks at the top of the health system","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emphasis on unsustainable pilot studies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of adaptive implementation of tailored programmes in the health system","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"}]}
